cluster_classes.class_description: Entities that denote the specific Hook Man urban legend and its concrete narrative instance, including the canonical legend and a particular telling of its events.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: "Hook Man" urban legend and "the tale" both refer to the same unfolding Hook Man narrative.

members.entity_description: A famous urban legend about an escaped criminal with a hook for a hand, told worldwide in various narrative versions.
The specific narrative instance of the Hook Man urban legend being described, including the events experienced by the young couple.

cluster_classes.class_description: Core narrative elements of the Hook Man urban legend, including the fugitive criminal and his distinctive hook hand.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: a news report about an escaped criminal with a hook for a hand

members.entity_description: A fugitive offender described in the news report, central to the Hook Man legend.
A metal hook replacing the criminal’s hand, a defining feature of the Hook Man.

remarks: After splitting out the antagonist and hook weapon, this class should only retain additional Hook Man narrative elements as they appear; review in future iterations to see if it is still needed or can be retired.

splits.name: Hook Man Antagonist
splits.description: The escaped criminal figure in the Hook Man legend, characterized as the dangerous human antagonist.

splits.name: Hook Man Hook Weapon
splits.description: The metal hook that replaces the antagonist's hand in the Hook Man legend, treated as a distinct iconic object/weapon.

args.justification: ClsC_869aa707 currently mixes two distinct concepts—a character (escaped criminal) and an object/physical attribute (hook for a hand); splitting yields cleaner, semantically coherent classes for the antagonist and his hook.

args.new_description: Entities representing the Hook Man urban legend as a whole (the canonical legend) and particular tellings or narrative instances of that legend.
args.justification: Renaming and refining ClsC_746fdaf8 clarifies that it covers the overall Hook Man legend and specific tellings, and assigning the class group connects it to other Hook Man–related classes.

args.new_description: Residual container for any remaining narrative elements of the Hook Man legend not captured by more specific classes (e.g., antagonist, hook weapon).
args.remark: After splitting out the antagonist and hook weapon, this class should only retain additional Hook Man narrative elements as they appear; review in future iterations to see if it is still needed or can be retired.
args.justification: Updating the metadata of the partially emptied source class clarifies its narrowed residual role and aligns it with the Hook Man class group.

args.new_description: The escaped criminal with a hook for a hand who serves as the central human antagonist in the Hook Man urban legend.
args.justification: Assigning the class group and confirming the label for the newly split antagonist class aligns it with the broader Hook Man schema and distinguishes it as a character.

args.new_description: The metal hook that replaces the antagonist's hand and functions as an iconic weapon and visual symbol within the Hook Man legend.
args.justification: Assigning a clear name, description, and Hook Man class group to the newly split hook-weapon class captures its role as a distinct iconic object within the legend.

executed_decisions.justification: ClsC_869aa707 currently mixes two distinct concepts—a character (escaped criminal) and an object/physical attribute (hook for a hand); splitting yields cleaner, semantically coherent classes for the antagonist and his hook.
